creativeJazzGA
Class RitchieCriteria

java.lang.Object
  creativeJazzGA.RitchieCriteria

public class RitchieCriteria
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
Anna Jordanous Based on Graeme Ritchie's criteria for creativity in examining the products of creative systems See: G. Ritchie. Some empirical criteria for attributing creativity to a computer program. Minds and Machines, 17:67Ð99, 2007. G. Ritchie. Assessing creativity. In Proceedings of the AISB Symposium on AI and Creativity in Arts and Science, York, UK, 2001.

private static int V(double alpha,
                     double beta,
                     Improvisations X)
Counts the number of items in Population X that are rated between alpha and beta for value

Parameters:
alpha - The minimum value being considered
beta - The maximum value being considered
X - The population being examined
Returns:
The number of items in that range

VintersectT

private static int VintersectT(double minV,
                               double maxV,
                               double minT,
                               double maxT,
                               Improvisations R)
Count the number of members of Population R that have a value rating between minV and maxV (inclusive) and a typicality rating between minT and maxT (inclusive)

Parameters:
minV - the minimum value being considered
maxV - the maximum value being considered
minT - the minimum typicality being considered
maxT - the maximum typicality being considered
R - the set of Population members being examined
Returns:
the number of members with value and typicality ratings in the specified range

calcCriteria1

private static boolean calcCriteria1(Improvisations R)
AV(typ, R) > theta, for suitable theta Considers whether the average typicality rating across the set R exceeds some threshold (theta)

Parameters:
R - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria
Returns:
true if the criteria is satisfied, and false otherwise

ratio( T[alpha, 1](R) / R ) > theta, for suitable alpha, theta Examines whether a significant proportion of the result set are indeed examples of the intended genre

Parameters:
R - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria
Returns:
true if the criteria is satisfied, and false otherwise

calcCriteria4

private static boolean calcCriteria4(Improvisations R)
ratio (V[gamma, 1](R) / R ) > theta, for suitable gamma, theta Examines whether a significant proportion of the result set score well in terms of quality

Parameters:

calcCriteria5

private static boolean calcCriteria5(Improvisations R)
ratio (V[gamma, 1](R) INTERSECT T[alpha, 1](R) / T[alpha, 1](R)) > theta for suitable alpha, gamma, theta Just looking at the items which meet some typicality threshold (i.e. which are genuine instances of the artefact class), checks what proportion of these also score well in terms of quality

Parameters:
R - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria
Returns:
true if the criteria is satisfied, and false otherwise

calcCriteria6

private static boolean calcCriteria6(Improvisations R)
ratio (V[gamma, 1](R) INTERSECT T[0, beta](R) / R) > theta for suitable beta, gamma, theta Considers whether a large proportion of the program's output falls into the (supposedly desirable) category of untypical but highly valued items.

Parameters:
R - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria
Returns:
true if the criteria is satisfied, and false otherwise

private static boolean calcCriteria7(Improvisations R)
ratio (V[gamma, 1](R) INTERSECT T[0, beta](R) / T[0, beta](R)) > theta for suitable beta, gamma, theta Considers whether a large proportion of the atypical items produced by the program are highly valued.

Parameters:
R - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria
Returns:
true if the criteria is satisfied, and false otherwise

R - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria
Returns:

calcCriteria9

private static boolean calcCriteria9(Improvisations R)
ratio(I INTERSECT R / I) > theta, for suitable theta Sees how many of the Inspiring set have been replicated in the program output (on the idea that it is good to be able to reproduce the inspiring set - personally I think this is far less important for creativity than criteria 10)

Parameters:
R - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria
Returns:
true if the criteria is satisfied, and false otherwise

calcCriteria10a

private static boolean calcCriteria10a(Improvisations R)
(1 - ratio(I INTERSECT R / R)) > theta, for suitable theta As producing more than just the inspiring set is generally agreed to be a symptom of creativity, this considers the ratio of the results not in the inspiring set against all results

Parameters:
R - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria
Returns:
true if the criteria is satisfied, and false otherwise

calcCriteria11

private static boolean calcCriteria11(Improvisations RminusI)
AV(typ, (R-I)) > theta, for suitable theta Looking just at novel items (i.e. not in the inspiring set), checks how many are exemplars of the chosen genre

Parameters:
RminusI - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria (with any duplications of the original inspiring set removed)
Returns:
true if the criteria is satisfied, and false otherwise

AV(val, (R-I)) > theta, for suitable theta Looking just at novel items, checks how many are highly valued

Parameters:
RminusI - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria (with any duplications of the original inspiring set removed)
Returns:
true if the criteria is satisfied, and false otherwise

calcCriteria16

private static boolean calcCriteria16(Improvisations RminusI)

Returns:

calcCriteria17

private static boolean calcCriteria17(Improvisations RminusI)
ratio(V[gamma, 1](R-I) INTERSECT T[alpha, 1](R-I) / (R-I)) > theta for suitable alpha, gamma, theta Considers the occurrence within the novel results of items which are of good quality and highly typical (i.e. demonstrate creativity within existing norms) c.f. Boden's exploratory creativity?

Parameters:
RminusI - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria (with any duplications of the original inspiring set removed)
Returns:
true if the criteria is satisfied, and false otherwise

calcCriteria18

private static boolean calcCriteria18(Improvisations RminusI)
ratio(V[gamma, 1](R-I) INTERSECT T[0, beta](R-I) / (R-I)) > theta for suitable beta, gamma, theta Considers the occurrence within the novel results of items which are of good quality and highly atypical (i.e. demonstrate some original deviation from past practice) c.f. Boden's transformational creativity?

Parameters:
RminusI - The population being examined for creativity on this criteria (with any duplications of the original inspiring set removed)
Returns:
true if the criteria is satisfied, and false otherwise
